synopsis.text:
Babylon Project may be a distant memory, but in 2002, Japan is once again on the brink of chaos. A United Nations Labor team in Southeast Asia is obliterated, marking the beginning of a sinister plot that threatens to shake the very foundations of Japan's military. As evidence of an imminent military takeover surfaces, the original members of the Special Vehicle Division (SVD) must reunite to safeguard their city from impending doom.

Meanwhile, Kiichi Gotou and his partner, Shinobu Nagumo, are entangled in a web of political intrigue following a missile attack on Yokohama Bay Bridge. A chance video recording implicates a military fighter plane, leading to a conflict that escalates into a state of emergency. As they navigate this precarious situation, they uncover a conspiracy that goes deeper than they could have imagined.

Adding a personal twist to the crisis, Nagumo discovers that the mastermind behind the operation is none other than her former teacher and ex-lover, Yukihito Tsuge. With the clock ticking, Gotou must rally his former Patlabor team, led by the skilled pilot Noa Izumi, to apprehend Tsuge and thwart his destructive plan for revenge. As Nagumo confronts her complex past, the team must stand together to protect Japan from the looming threat of armed revolution and widespread panic on the streets of Tokyo.
